* The DukeException Class extends Exception and is

* The EmptyDescriptionException Class extends DukeException and
* is used to denote when a command has a missing description
* The Event class extends Task. An event has 2 extra fields

* The Task class is to encapsulate the task into a single object
* It will contain the description and whether it has been completed
* @return returns a boolean value of whether the task is completed
* Method to mark task as done
* Method to mark task as undone
* The Storage class contains a fixed sized array that
* stores the input from the parser class and can also
* display the stored values to the user
* Method that adds a task to the storage
* @param t The task to be added
System.out.println("Here are the tasks in your list:");
* Marks a specific task as done
* @param index the index of the task to be marked
* Marks a specific task as undone
* @param index the index of the task to be unmarked
* Method that removes a specific task from storage
* @param index the index of the task to be removed
* The UI class contains methods that generate UI elements
* The UnknownCommandException extends DukeException and is used
* to denote that Duke does not understand that particular command
